author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump told New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani that he could “just say yes” when Mamdani was asked if he had affirmed he believed the president is a fascist.  “He asked about your comment calling President Trump a fascist and your answer was, ‘Both President Trump and I have been clear about our positions…
title: Trump to Mamdani on being a fascist: ‘You can just say yes’

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Rep. Jason Crow (D-Colo.), one of the six Democratic lawmakers President Trump suggested should face punishment “by death” for alleged acts of sedition, reported the leader’s post on social media to Capitol Police.  Crow’s office said the president’s Thursday statement on Truth Social was “intimidating, threatening, and concerning” and has caused an increase in threats…
title: Democrat asks Capitol Police to investigation Trump sedition posts

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump said Friday he did not agree with Rep. Elise Stefanik’s (R-N.Y.) past description of New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani as a “jihadist” following his meeting with Mamdani at the White House. Trump was asked about the description from Stefanik, who is running for governor of New York in next year’s election, while…
title: Trump brushes off Stefanik’s ‘jihadist’ label for Mamdani: ‘She’s out there campaigning’

author: Sarakshi Rai
description: President Trump praised New York City’s Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani (D) in a closely-watched meeting in the Oval Office on Friday. Trump said he congratulated Mamdani on his victory, and the two men exchange pleasantries, adding they agreed on a lot of issues. “I think you’re going to have hopefully a great mayor,” the president said.…
title: Watch Trump, Mamdani speak to reporters: ‘I think you’re going to have a really great mayor’

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump said Friday he would feel comfortable living in New York City while Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani (D) is in office. “Yeah, I would. I really would. Especially after the meeting,” Trump told reporters. “We agree on a lot more than I thought. I want him to do a great job, and we’ll help him…
title: Trump says he would be ‘comfortable’ living in New York under Mamdani

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump on Friday offered praise for New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani after what the two called a “productive” meeting at the White House, a sharp shift from Trump’s previous attacks when he repeatedly derided Mamdani as a “communist.” “I think you’re going to have, hopefully, a really great mayor. The better he does,…
title: Trump offers praise for ‘rational’ Mamdani in remarkable White House meeting

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump on Friday argued he wasn’t threatening Democratic lawmakers when he called them traitors and accused them of “seditious behavior,” but he said those members are in “serious trouble.” “I’m not threatening them, but I think they’re in serious trouble. I would say they are in serious trouble. I’m not threatening death. But I…
title: Trump says he wasn’t threatening lawmakers with posts about ‘seditious behavior’

author: Surina Venkat
description: Three Republican-led states have challenged the Food and Drug Administration’s (FDA) approval of a generic form of the abortion pill mifepristone earlier this year, arguing the agency’s decision had ignored the “dangerous effects of mifepristone on pregnant women and girls.” The attorney generals for Missouri, Kansas and Idaho earlier this week filed an amended complaint…
title: GOP-led states challenging FDA approval of generic abortion pill

author: Michael Kunzelman
description: Grammy-winning rapper Prakazrel “Pras” Michel of the Fugees was sentenced on Thursday to 14 years in prison for a case in which he was convicted of illegally funneling millions of dollars in foreign contributions to former President Barack Obama’s 2012 reelection campaign.
title: Fugees rapper Pras Michel sentenced to 14 years in prison over illegal donations to Obama campaign

author: Laura Kelly
description: Rep. Brian Fitzpatrick (R-Pa.) on Friday said he has submitted a discharge petition to force a vote on bipartisan legislation imposing punishing sanctions on countries enabling Russia’s war against Ukraine.  The move comes as President Trump is putting intense pressure on Kyiv to accept a peace proposal widely criticized as favorable toward Moscow.  “This Russian-drafted…
title: House Republican moves to force vote on ‘crushing Russia sanctions’

author: Teddy Grant
description: With the rise of AI, scammers are using the images of stars and influencers to trick fans.
title: Taylor Swift, Tom Cruise and Scarlett Johansson top list of deepfaked stars

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: A quartet of bipartisan House members on Friday unveiled legislation to extend ObamaCare’s enhanced subsidies for two years along with some changes to try to assuage conservatives’ concerns about fraud.  The bill from Reps. Don Bacon (R-Neb.), Tom Suozzi (D-N.Y.), Josh Gottheimer (D-N.J.), and Jeff Hurd (R-Colo.) comprises the principles they previously publicly unveiled.   The bill is aimed at breaking through the…
title: Bipartisan House lawmakers float two-year ACA subsidy extension

author: Meg Hilling
description: “It’s time to bring back civility and manners when we travel," Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said.
title: Why flyers are being asked to behave with more ‘civility’

author: Nicole Tam
description: A man who deputies say broke into a home, attacked a homeowner and killed a dog has been charged with three felonies.
title: Michigan couple mourns after attacker kills ‘hero’ dog

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Former Rep. Tim Ryan (D-Ohio) announced Friday he is not planning to launch a bid for Ohio governor, leaving an opening for former state health director Dr. Amy Acton to become the Democratic nominee. “After careful consideration, much prayer and reflection, and after long conversations with my family, my closest friends and advisors, I’ve made…
title: Tim Ryan won’t run for Ohio governor next year

author: George Knapp
description: A 55-year-old mystery about a Canadian woman who seemingly fell off the face of the Earth was partially solved earlier this month with the announcement that human remains found in the desert more than half a century ago had finally been identified.
title: Las Vegas father-son pair linked to 55-year-old cold case slaying

author: Sylvan Lane
description: The Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) announced Friday that it would not produce its highly anticipated monthly inflation report for October after being unable to collect key data during the government shutdown. BLS said it will not release an update to the consumer price index (CPI) for October because it was unable to retroactively obtain…
title: Bureau of Labor Statistics cancels October inflation report due to shutdown

author: Jeremy Tanner
description: President Trump's announcement of a potential tariff-funded $2,000 check for Americans fueled wave of excitement, but for those people already thinking about the bills, necessities or holiday expenses on which to spend it, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent has a different suggestion.
title: Hoping to spend Trump’s proposed $2K checks? Treasury secretary has another idea

author: Chris Truax, opinion contributor
description: Watching the bill to release the Epstein files go from a stalled discharge petition with 217 signatures to passing both houses of Congress by a combined vote of 527-1 has got to be one of the most dramatic events in American political history.
title: The Epstein files are a turning point in the Trump presidency, but it’s not over yet

author: Cate Martel
description: 12:30 Report is The Hill’s midday newsletter. Subscribe here. Happy Friday! Who’s planning to see Wicked: For Good this weekend?! In today’s issue: • Trump hosts Mamdani • White House gives Ukraine new deadline • Johnson, Thune out of sync • DOJ says grand jury reviewed Comey charges 🤝 IN THE WHITE HOUSE Is it…
title: Mamdani enters MAGA territory

author: Michael Bartiromo
description: The U.S. Department of Transportation is hoping the public will help usher in a “Golden Age of Travel” — and it apparently means dressing up before you head to the airport.
title: Trump official wants us to dress with ‘respect’ on planes. What does that mean, exactly?

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: The editorial board of the Wall Street Journal is warning that a failed effort by Republicans to gerrymander congressional districts in Texas could cost the party in the long term. “President Trump’s insistence that Texas Republicans redraw their House map before the 2026 midterms is looking like it could backfire in a big way,” the…
title: Wall Street Journal: Failed Texas gerrymandering push ‘could cost’ Republicans their House majority

author: Michael D. Stinnett, opinion contributor
description: The White House's decision to withhold October's employment and inflation data is a policy rupture with profound implications, as it moves from transparency to tactical informational control and risks eroding trust in the country's economic data.
title: The White House’s jobs-data blackout and the erosion of economic transparency

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Rep. Chrissy Houlahan (D-Pa.) on Friday slammed House Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) for not condemning President Trump’s recent post suggesting six Democratic lawmakers should be put to “death” for urging military members to defy what they classified as “illegal orders.” “The words that the president chose are not the ones that I would use. Okay?…
title: House Democrat knocks ‘mealy-mouthed’ Johnson response to Trump sedition post

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: The Alabama Public Library Service Board of Directors voted Thursday to remove books about transgender individuals or that state there are more than two genders from the children’s section of public libraries.  The new rule says books about “transgender procedures, gender ideology or the concept of more than two biological genders” have to be placed…
title: Alabama library board votes to pull books that discuss being transgender from children’s sections

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Rep. Eric Swalwell (D-Calif.) said Thursday Democrats need to be “more open” to people like Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Ga.) — after she broke with President Trump on a number of issues. Greene’s criticism of House Republican leaders during the record-long government shutdown and her public rift with Trump has captured headlines in recent weeks.…
title: Swalwell on Greene: ‘I can put the crazy aside and bring her under the tent’

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) said Thursday that its operations in Charlotte, N.C., will not be ending “anytime soon,“ conflicting with reports from local law enforcement who said immigration officials have left the city.  “Operation Charlotte’s Web isn’t ending anytime soon,” DHS Assistant Secretary Tricia McLaughlin wrote in a statement on social platform X.…
title: DHS: Charlotte immigration operation ‘not ending anytime soon’

author: Colin Meyn
description: After weeks of stalled talks over Russia’s war on Ukraine, Axios reported this week that Washington and Moscow had quietly hammered out a 28-point proposal to end the war.  U.S. Army Secretary Daniel Driscoll visited Kyiv on Thursday to discuss the plan with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, who said he expected a call with President…
title: What’s in Trump plan to end war in Ukraine?

author: Jusolyn Flower
description: A teenager was nearly taken into federal immigration custody in Providence Thursday afternoon before a Superior Court judge intervened, according to the Rhode Island Judiciary.
title: RI judge intervenes after ICE wrongfully detains high school Superior Court intern

author: Ismail Cidic, opinion contributor
description: The Dayton Agreement remains one of the most successful U.S. diplomatic achievements of the post-World War II period, but the United States must reassert its support for Bosnia and hold accountable those working against American interests in order to ensure a resilient, reform-driven and Euro-Atlantic-anchored Bosnia.
title: 30 years since the Dayton Agreement, the US must reengage in Bosnia

author: Ellen Mitchell
description: Thousands of veterans discharged from the military for refusing the COVID-19 vaccine during the Biden administration may regain eligibility for GI Bill education benefits, according to the Department of Veterans Affairs. More than 8,000 service members were separated from the military for refusing to comply with the Pentagon’s coronavirus shot mandate, which was implemented in…
title: Veterans discharged for refusing COVID vaccine could see GI bill benefits restored

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Authorities on Friday responded to reports of an “unknown substance” at a Dallas Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) facility targeted by a gunman earlier this year. “The preliminary investigation determined that a suspicious package was located inside a government facility,” Michael Dennis, a Dallas Police Department spokesperson, told the Hill. “No injuries were reported,” Dennis…
title: ‘Unknown substance’ reported at Dallas ICE facility

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Longtime Republican pollster Frank Luntz says President Trump has a deadline to address price increases and affordability concerns as his first year back in the White House winds down. “We’re gonna know the impact of prices one week from now at Thanksgiving and for the next five or six weeks,” Luntz said during an appearance…
title: Luntz: Trump has until Labor Day ‘to turn things around’

author: The Hill Staff
description: Rep. Eugene Vindman (D-Va.) will speak with reporters Friday morning as he seeks more information from President Trump and his administration on the 2018 assassination of journalist Jamal Khashoggi in Istanbul. The pressure comes just days after the president welcomed Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman to the White House, when they faced questions over…
title: Watch live: Vindman presses Trump for transparency on Khashoggi death after Saudi crown prince visit

author: Noah Bookbinder, opinion contributor
description: These aren’t mere details, they are the difference between a functioning democracy and a slip into authoritarianism.
title: The Comey and James indictments are far from business as usual

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-Mass.) is warning the head of media conglomerate Paramount that she is ready to stand in the way of the company’s growth, which she argues is becoming increasingly anti-competitive. “We don’t think one man or one corporation named David Ellison should be able to buy up all the shows and buy up…
title: Warren warns Paramount chief: One man shouldn’t be able to ‘decide who watches what’

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Sen. Mark Kelly (D-Ariz.) expressed surprise and anger Thursday at President Trump’s suggestion that he and six Democrats with military or national security backgrounds be put to “death” for “seditious behavior.” “I’ve had a missile blow up next to my airplane, been shot at dozens of times by anti-aircraft fire, and launched into orbit —…
title: Sen. Mark Kelly: ‘I never thought I’d see a President call for my execution’

author: Matt Lewis, opinion contributor
description: Somewhere out there, some naive souls are salivating over the smoking gun evidence that is about to finally take Trump down.
title: On Epstein, Democrats shouldn’t get their hopes up

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump lifted his administration’s 40 percent tariffs on Brazilian food products on Thursday, marking the latest reversal on a string of tariffs that were imposed on other countries earlier this year.  The action removes tariffs from products including coffee, fruit, cocoa, and beef. They were first imposed in July in an effort to punish…
title: Trump lifts tariffs on Brazilian beef, coffee

author: Jeremy Tanner
description: After seeing how much interest one would pay on an average 50-year mortgage in 20 major U.S. cities, some home buyers might opt for a traditional loan, even if President Trump's proposal becomes law.
title: 50-year mortgage? Here’s how much you’d end up paying in 20 major cities: report

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Rep. Eric Swalwell (D-Calif.) on Thursday announced his decision to jump into next year‘s race to replace term-limited Gov. Gavin Newsom (D), saying, “I’m ready to bring this fight home.” Swalwell told, in a conversation with ABC‘s Jimmy Kimmel, said the Golden State “needs a fighter and a protector.” “Someone who will bring prices down,…
title: Swalwell announces California governor campaign

author: Jared Gans
description: Morning Report is The Hill’s a.m. newsletter. Subscribe here. In today’s issue: ▪ Mamdani heads to Washington ▪ Trump infuriates Dems with ‘sedition’ branding ▪ D.C. National Guard deployment blocked ▪ ACA subsidies unlikely to be extended 3 Things to Know Today 1. Rep. Eric Swalwell (D-Calif.) has launched a bid for California governor, joining an increasingly crowded race.…
title: Trump plays host to vocal foe Mamdani

author: Filip Timotija
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said the U.S. government’s decision to designate Venezuela’s Cartel de los Soles a foreign terrorist organization provides the Defense Department with “new options” to go after the alleged drug cartel, which officials alleged is headed by Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro.  “Well, it brings a whole bunch of new options to the…
title: Hegseth says terror designation provides Pentagon with ‘new options’ to go after Venezuela’s Cartel de los Soles
